com.codepotato.model

Class SampleReader

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.codepotato.model.SampleReader

  • public class SampleReader
extends java.lang.Object
    SampleReader is responsible for reading data from an audio file in the form of samples (type double). Used by Player.
    Author:
    Michael Santer

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      SampleReader(java.io.File file, int sampleRate, int bitRate, int numChan)
      Constructor opens an audio file for reading.

      Converts sample of type double into 2 bytes, and stores into the byte buffer starting at the given offset.

      • SampleReader

            int sampleRate,
            int bitRate,
            int numChan)
             throws java.io.IOException

        file - an audio file.

        bitRate - 8 or 16
        numChan - 1 or 2

              throws java.io.IOException

        number of available bytes to read.

      • nextSample

        public double nextSample()
                  throws java.io.IOException
        Returns:
        The next available sample. If no samples are available, it returns 0.
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException

      • sampleToBytes

        public void sampleToBytes(double sample,
                 byte[] buff,
                 int offset)
        Converts sample of type double into 2 bytes, and stores into the byte buffer starting at the given offset.
        Parameters:
        sample - audio sample of type double
        buff - an array of bytes
        offset - the offset of the buffer to write to.
